problem_text:
Let a be the unique integer modulo M = 9·25·49·13^2·17^2 for which
  a ≡ 4 (mod 9),   a ≡ 6 (mod 25),   a ≡ 8 (mod 49),   a ≡ 12 (mod 13^2),   a ≡ 16 (mod 17^2).
These congruences ensure v_3(a−1) = v_5(a−1) = v_7(a−1) = 1 and v_{13}(a+1) = v_{17}(a+1) = 1.
Determine the minimal positive integer n such that simultaneously
  v_3(a^n − 1) = 5,   v_5(a^n − 1) = 4,   v_7(a^n − 1) = 3,   v_{13}(a^n − 1) = 6,   v_{17}(a^n − 1) = 5.
Give your final answer as a single integer in canonical prime-power factorization.

theorem_refs.name: LTE
theorem_refs.statement: v_p(a^n−1) for p|a−1 or p|a+1 (n even)
